result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Tyree Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Injunction Petitioner [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the  sentence ordered in 15CF2974.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, the DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Provide a DNA sample.  
Court advised of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition; and that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample; his voting rights are suspended and may never possess firearms.

No contact with victim without the approval of the Court or agent.  May have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by the agent.
No firearms.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling or anger management, and continued programming.
Complete a parenting class.
Comply with any treatment deemed appropriate/recommended.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon Tyree Allen in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Devon Tyree Allen in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Deborah S.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 28 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 2 days served, consecutive to the sentence ordered in 15CF2974.  Court ordered 14 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 14 MONTHS Extended Supervision. 
Court found defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and the Substance Abuse program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant to 3 YEARS PROBATION.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Complete a parentig class.
-No contact with victim without the approval of the Court or agent.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by the agent.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms.
-Provide a DNA sample.
-Comply with any treatment deemed appropriate/recommended.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, the DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.


Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, letter from the defendant, Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Devon Tyree Allen in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Devon Tyree Allen in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for Nick Heitman for  the State of Wisconsin.
To the charged offense:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Devon Tyree Allen in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Devon Tyree Allen in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
